required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Comfilcon A Toric Contact Lenses and Samfilcon A Toric Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: A Bilateral Dispensing Comparison of Biofinity Toric and Ultra for Astigmatism

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the subjective acceptance of comfilcon A toric contact lens, compared to samfilcon A toric lens.

primary_outcome.description: Subjective ratings of comfort for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=painful,10=can't feel lens)
Lens preference with respect to comfort (Prefer pair-1 strongly, Prefer pair-1 slightly, Prefer pair-2 strongly, prefer pair-2 slightly, No preference)
Subjective ratings of dryness for each pair of lenses (scale: 0-10; 0=Extremely dry, 10=No dryness)
Lens preference with respect to dryness (Prefer pair-1 strongly, Prefer pair-1 slightly, Prefer pair-2 strongly, prefer pair-2 slightly, No preference)

secondary_outcome.description: Subjective rating of ease of inserting the lens onto the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)
Subjective rating of ease of removing the lens from the eye (scale 0-10; 0=very difficult, 10=very easy)

arm_group.description: Subjects who wear comfilcon A toric lens either as first or second pair during this cross-over study.
Subjects who wear samfilcon A toric lens either as first or second pair during this cross-over study.

overall_official.affiliation: Director, Centre for Ocular Research & Education
